1 tutorials there are video tutorials on my youtube channel for a variety of stitches and techniques there is a tutorial for how to knit continental this is a good practice pattern for that youtube channel kari pedersen -- click link to open -- https //www youtube com/channel/uc7zq8hfi_c7vcggfsy0mg5a/videos abbreviations co = cast on bor = beginning of round k = knit p = purl k2tog = knit two stitches together *_* = repeat from * to * until end of round what is between the stars is repeated that row gauge yarn 19-21 stitches & 20-22 row per 4 on us any bulky weight yarn 10 6mm needles in pattern laid flat i used malabrigo mecha note that stitches appear to overlap yardage pattern is made to fit even if your gauge is not exact folded brim may require additional yarn xxs 70-80 yards sizing xs 80-90 yards the size can be adjusted in increments of 2 s 90-105 yards m 95-115 yards suggested cast on for each size l 115-130 yards xxs infant s/baby s 13 -17 ~ 48 stitches xs toddler s 17 -19 ~ 56 stitches materials s child s/junior s 19 -21 ~ 64 stitches size us 10 6mm 16 circular needles m women s 21 -23 ~ 72 stitches size us 10 6mm double point needles l men s 23 + ~ 76 stitches stitch marker tapestry needle finished dimensions optional yarn or fur pom laid flat hat will stretch when worn xxs 7 wide by 7 5 tall xs 7 5 wide by 8 tall s 8 wide by 8 tall m 8 5 wide by 8 5 tall l 9 wide by 9 tall bonanza beanie - 2 body this is a pattern does not have a different brim pattern meaning the same needle size and pattern are used for the entire hat until the decrease you may use as many colors as you would like for this beanie it doesn t have to be one color co the stitch count for your size xxs 48 xs 56 s 64 m 72 l 76 onto size us 10 6mm circular needles or dpn s for child size using long tail cast on or your preferred co join in the round being careful not to twist the stitches and place bor stitch marker round 1 * k1 p1* repeat round 1 until your beanie reaches approximately single brim
